message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "The study draws on data from the Climate Hazards Group InfraRed Precipitation with Station Data (CHIRPS) dataset over the period of 1960-2018, combined with data on crop yields and soil properties.", "dataset": ["Climate Hazards Group InfraRed Precipitation with Station Data (CHIRPS) dataset"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "This paper examines the role of public-private partnerships in delivering digital infrastructure through the analysis of two datasets: the World Bank's Private Participation in Infrastructure database and the International Telecommunication Union's ICT Development Index.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Private Participation in Infrastructure database", "International Telecommunication Union's ICT Development Index"], "topic": ["Digital Development", "Public-Private Partnerships"]}, {"sentence": "We use panel data from the ASEAN integration report to investigate the impacts of the ASEAN Economic Community (AEC) on trade costs among the member countries.", "dataset": ["ASEAN integration report"], "topic": ["Regional Integration"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses a panel dataset of 153 countries to explore the relationship between female parliamentary representation and income inequality, controlling for other socio-economic factors.", "dataset": ["panel dataset of 153 countries"], "topic": ["Gender", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We used household survey data from a nationally representative sample of India to examine the intersection of caste and gender in determining access to education and employment opportunities.", "dataset": ["household survey data from a nationally representative sample of India"], "topic": ["Education", "Gender"]}, {"sentence": "This paper analyses data on 800 firms across various economic sectors in Uganda, gathered through a firm-level survey, to explore the determinants of competitiveness and its implications on job creation.", "dataset": ["data on 800 firms across various economic sectors in Uganda gathered through a firm-level survey"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We combine climate data from the Global Historical Climatology Network dataset with household survey data to investigate the impact of climate change on child malnutrition in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Global Historical Climatology Network dataset", "household survey data"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses a unique dataset of mobile phone usage patterns to analyse the relationship between urbanisation and social networks, exploring how communication patterns change as cities grow bigger.", "dataset": ["unique dataset of mobile phone usage patterns"], "topic": ["Urban Development", "Social Sustainability and Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "Using survey data from households located near mining sites in four African countries, we explore the differential impacts of extractive industries on community well-being and resilience.", "dataset": ["survey data from households located near mining sites in four African countries"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries", "Disaster Risk Management", "Fragility, Conflict and Violence"]}, {"sentence": "This paper utilises multiple datasets, including the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys and cross-country data on patent applications, to investigate the complex relationship between innovation, small businesses, and economic development.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys", "cross-country data on patent applications"], "topic": ["Macroeconomics", "Financial Sector", "Jobs \u0026 Development"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "The study draws on data from the Climate Hazards Group InfraRed Precipitation with Station Data (CHIRPS) dataset over the period of 1960-2018, combined with data on crop yields determining access to education and employment opportunities.", "dataset": ["household survey data from a nationally representative sample of India"], "topic": ["Education", "Gender"]}, {"sentence": creation.", "dataset": ["data on 800 firms across various economic sectors in Uganda gathered through a firm-level survey"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We combine climate data from the Global Historical Climatology Network dataset with household survey data to investigate the impact of climate change on child malnutrition in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Global Historical Climatology Network dataset", "household survey data"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses a unique dataset of mobile phone usage patterns to analyse the relationship between urbanisation and social networks, exploring how communication patterns change as cities grow bigger.", "dataset": ["unique dataset of mobile phone usage differential impacts of extractive industries on community well-being and resilience.", "dataset": ["survey data from households located near mining sites in four African countries"], "topic": cross-country data on patent applications, to investigate the complex relationship between innovation, small businesses, and economic development.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys", "cross-country data on patent applications"], "topic": ["Macroeconomics", "Financial Sector", "Jobs \u0026 Development"]}]
